page.title: 04SADBERGE SHEPHERD'S FARM
page.content: The farmer's name is Christopher Shepherd but I just call him Chris,his wife is called Sally and they haven't any children .Their farm house is quite old it was built about 1865.The bricks for the house were all made by hand.The farm is 225 acres.He has 70 calves.They have two sheep dogs called Tweed and Bill their job is to guard the farm.Alan Armstrong also works on the farm,he drives the tractor and looks after the cattle.One of the fields cannot be ploughed because it contains remains of a Roman fort.I hope that someday, someone comes along and excavates the field and finds some interesting Roman remains. From our classroom window we can see the field with all its funny shaped lumps and bumps. { } By Suzanne Yole aged 9
